security: Revealing the official displeasure of the US government towards JYVAPOROUS for sharing files on Lee Harvey Oswald with Norman Mailer could damage the liaison relationship. Directly quoting: "...OFFICIAL DISPLEASURE THAT *JYVAPOROUS, UNCOOPERATIVE IN SHARING ITS FILES ON<LEE> *<HARVEY OSWALD WITH USG, MADE SOME OF THEM AVAILABLE TO NORMAN MAILER FOR HIS BOOK..."
summary: A cable from Minsk requests guidance on whether to question JYVAPOROUS about sharing Lee Harvey Oswald files with Norman Mailer, given the US government's displeasure.
summary_one_paragraph: This secret cable, dated July 31, 1995, originates from the Minsk station, requesting guidance from the Director regarding a potential inquiry to JYVAPOROUS. The US Ambassador has received a State Department cable indicating official displeasure that JYVAPOROUS shared files on Lee Harvey Oswald with Norman Mailer for his book, instead of providing them to the US government. The Minsk station seeks direction on whether to follow up with JYVAPOROUS, referencing prior discussions about a lack of reciprocity in their liaison relationship.
title: Request for Guidance on Questioning JYVAPOROUS about Sharing Oswald Files
